jobs.title: Content Marketing Manager (B2B)
jobs.description:
Mews is looking to add an experienced B2B Content Marketing Manager to our growing Marketing team. 

As the Content Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for designing and delivering unique and compelling product marketing content, customer success stories and other thought provoking material. You will be proficient in producing a wide range of high quality, creative content including video / blogs / webinars & podcasts that really captures the Mews tone of voice. 

You will thrive in a dynamic, fast paced environment and work collaboratively with various stakeholders. Highly organised with a creative flare and great sense of humour, this role will offer incredible opportunity and freedom to create exceptional content to drive our brand forward. 

The Role
•	Design a Content Strategy that will drive Sales Leads 
•	Day-to-day creating and publishing of content 
•	Work collaboratively with both Creative, Digital and Product teams 
•	Maintain clear and consistent tone of voice 
•	Increase brand awareness
•	Monitor and work to improve engagement 
•	Work to a world-class model that elevates Mews above other B2B companies and uniquely reflect our brand ethos and value proposition
•	Engage freelancers when required 

Candidate Requirements

•	4 to 7 years of experience in a content manager, editorial or project management position
•	Extraordinary organization skills and ability to work across concurrent workstreams
•	Comfortable working collaboratively
•	Detail-oriented and committed to editing accuracy
•	Proficiency with content management systems, production and publishing
•	Writing and editing skills: excellence with English language and grammar
•	General photo-editing skills preferred
•	Project management: some experience coordinating longer-term development projects
•	Able to think ahead and be proactive on next steps
•	Familiarity and interest in both Tech and Hospitality 
•	Interested in process improvement, technology and content management
•	Excellent communication skills; present ideas in clear and logical way
•	Ability to work in fast-paced environment

Our Culture and Benefits
We believe that excellence can be achieved through a dynamic culture driven by collaboration and teamwork. 
At Mews we promote an environment of trust, respect and flexibility which allows us to not only support and learn from one another but motivate our team to push the boundaries in our own specialisms. 
Our Values
-	Ambitious 
-	Agile
-	Grit
-	Playful
-	Kind
You will be working some of the most innovative minds in our industry along with the following benefits:
-	Discounted travel (25-50%) at Mews hotels in 35+ countries
-	Flexible working
-	Excellent holiday allowance 
-	Diverse and multicultural working environment 
-	Regular team outings (2+ annual company trips)
-	Stocked fridge with soft drinks / snacks
-	Mews Library

jobs.title: Data Scientist Intern - Research Team
jobs.description:
We are seeking bright, self-starting interns - with the possibility of becoming full-time employees - to join our recently founded research team. 

The research team is responsible for conducting strategic research to support Mews’ expansion into new markets. This is an incredible opportunity to get exposure to top level management and take ownership of projects from day one. 

The ideal candidate for this role is someone with a numerical background, proficiency in python and experience with predictive modelling. 



Responsibilities: 

- Maintain and refine the end-to-end data pipeline, building on existing architectures for data collection, processing, and analysis

- Construct, clean and structure raw databases based on the team’s research findings in collaboration with our Prague data team.

- Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets

- Build algorithms and design experiments to merge, manage, verify and extract data to supply tailored reports to colleagues, customers or the wider organisation

- Work with various Mews teams to solve highly complex problems. Projects include anything from optimising our revenue predictions to researching new territories in which to sell our services.

Requirements: 

- Advanced knowledge of Python 

- Strong mathematical background

- Experience with predictive modelling 

- Drive and the resilience to try new ideas if the first one doesn't work - you'll be expected to work with minimal supervision

- Previous experience interning in a software company or within a tech team

- Experience with web crawling is a big plus 

- Knowledge of web development (javascript/HTML/CSS) is an advantage

jobs.title: Sales Development Rep - various territories
jobs.description:
We are looking for someone who can contribute to the company’s growth whilst bringing structure, analysis and reporting to this growing organization. Our ideal candidate is a smart, articulate individual with a proactive approach who loves challenges and enjoys working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

What should you be like?

· Motivated, able to work independently and as part of a team

· Highly structured and organized. This is a fast paced environment

· A genuine interest in new technologies that bring innovation in hospitality (and not only)

· Hands-on approach, willing to go the extra mile

· Ability to take feedback, learn quickly and adapt to new situations

· A driver of new ideas and suggestions in order to move the company forward

· Not afraid to challenge the status quo

· Outgoing, social, ready to communicate with employees, customers, and partners across different countries and different organizational levels

· A bit crazy :-)

What should you have?

· Fluent in English and 1 or more of: German, Swedish, Danish, Finish, Polish, Czech/Slovak, French

· Tech Savvy (further knowledge than MS Office/GDrive)

· Education preferably in Marketing/Business/Hospitality

· Experience in the hotel/travel industry and growth hacking

The role will evolve as the company grows, but the main focus will be to:

· Research, identify and prospect new clients. You will be expected to meet certain metrics as defined by the sales approach. These metrics may include outbound prospecting, inbound qualification, opportunities found and passed.

· Use a consultative approach to understand a prospect’s organizational goals and needs, identify the key “pain points” and build trust.

· Achieve department and organizational goals by accepting ownership of projects for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to the team.

· Assist in administrative tasks (Contracts, Internal Documentation, software maintenance).

· Analyse business reports to identify patterns in the opportunities and come up with ideas/strategies to further streamline these channels

· Collaborate with the marketing team to help identify best practices, and further stimulate website traffic

· Come up with innovative ideas to drive new business opportunities & to improve efficiency

· Help drive new leads/opportunities for the sales team throughout campaigns

· Participating in creative brainstorms

· You own side project (not job-role related) that brings value to the company

Where will you work from?

Your role will initially be based out of the London office, which is centrally located. There could be an opportunity to relocate to the region of focus in the future.

Please apply here: https://mews-systems.breezy.hr/p/4e727aa72e0401-head-of-marketing

jobs.title: UI Designer
jobs.description:
You will work with us in the Product management team - including Product managers, Product designers and UI designers - all with the ultimate goal of delivering the best Property Management System of the 21st century. 

Your responsibility will be creating a clean and modern User Interface, which inevitably leads to a great user experience. If you know how to create UI for multi-page web, native applications, landing pages, small forms or icons, and infographics, that’s fantastic. If you know how to to do it creatively and effectively, then you might be a perfect match. 

Can you execute your design process from concept to final design before handing it over to our development team? We use Agile/Scrum, does that ring any bells? But wait, can you also present and defend your ideas and designs? Even better!

We primarily use Sketch, Flinto, Zeplin and Adobe After Effects, you too? High five!

We really try to “Keep things simple and consistent”, and we apply these standards to our design guidelines, best practices, and standards. Does that sound like a deal?

Not to mention, we are sitting in the most beautiful city in the world - Prague.
